snippet: American policy makers have made decisions in the last year that strengthened the nation’s economy, while their European counterparts have made costly missteps.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column contends American policy makers have made decisions in the last year that strengthened the nation’s economy, while their European counterparts have made costly missteps; holds that no one factor made the difference in the divergent paths, but cites especially the benefits of the bank bailouts and monetary policy known as quantitative easing.
lead_paragraph: American policy makers have made decisions in the last year that strengthened the nation’s economy, while their European counterparts have made costly missteps.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Chose Better Path To Recovery
headline.seo: U.S. Chose Better Path to Economic Recovery
headline.main: U.S. Chose Better Path to Recovery
